column4: hey guys, i've got a little question: i've just installed 11.04, logged into ubuntu-classic by default, installed nvidia-current (i'm using geforce 6150 on a desktop), rebooted, but it's still running ubuntu-classic by default, even if i select just ubuntu from gdm login screen, any idea? i wanna try out unity!
try logging out and when at login screen usually at the bottom you can select your desktop environment after clicking your name
isn't the 'ubuntu' session the unity one?
since 9.10 mine autologins to last session
I would think so but I have a kustom Gnome desktop so I havent used unity at all
i keep selecting the session 'ubunt' but still it runs gnome 2.3.x
I am looking at it on http://scottlinux.com/2011/03/05/ubuntu-11-04-change-from-unity-to-classic-gnome/ link there
well I am going to start the upgrade now and I will be albe to tell you for sure soon
or you may hear me cussing at my computer from anyplace in the world..... ;)
don't take such a work if it's not necessary
I want to make the upgrade anyway but dual screens make upgrading a pain at times
check your proprietary drivers
did you check your proprietary drivers?
they are usualy disabled on upgrade
what do you mean by checking? i installed 11.04 from stracth, then installed nvidia-current package
ok sounds like you have the correct drivers then and they are enabled
i think they are
unity may have a small glitch on your system
i will not make much of a trouble of it...i just wanted to try it but then install gnome 3 any way :P
well I am doing my upgrade now so I hope some luck fallows me today
good luck with that :P
ty for the luck wishes
